title: Disney Streaming
subtitle: Present, Summer 2020, Summer 2019
summary: After interning twice for the company in the summer of 2019 and 2020, I will be an associate software engineer for DSS upon my graduation in May.
description:
2020:
  • Was responsible for critical portions of our team’s implementation of a higher-level project.
  • Contributed to development of a utility API for our teams and partners using AWS, Java, and Spring framework.
  • Handled load-testing of endpoints with JMeter and backfilled data for hundreds of thousands of files.
  • Coordinated with teams and facilitated deployments from testing to production environments.

2019:
  • Created Jenkins parameterized pipelines with Groovy and Ansible playbooks for deployment and invocation of the testing framework and API, optimizing our testing methodology and greatly improving our release time to production.
  • Analyzed various tools for testing, including SonarQube for analysis of our unit & integration tests, code coverage, and vulnerabilities.
  • Integrated test result reporting to Slack and test visualization software.

title: Perlmutter App
subtitle: Spring 2020—Present
summary: In late April, I began working under Prof. Gene Miller to develop the Perlmutter App, a communication framework allowing non-profits to interface with constituents.
description:
In late April, I began working under Prof. Gene Miller of the Brandeis International Business School alongside Mitchell Dodell and Daniel Khudyak to develop solutions for non-profits in the post-COVID environment. Perlmutter App is a communication framework allowing non-profits to interface with constituents via web-app, phone, and/or email, in a unified format.

Organizations can send events, information, and messages as admins to users via call, text, email, or in-app newsletter.

Our primary client is The Haven Project, an impactful organization started to address a gap in services to unaccompanied homeless young adults and surrounding communities. They provide direct service to more than 200 homeless unaccompanied youth ages 17-24 each year in their Drop-in Centers, with referrals to other youth serving organizations for hundreds more who don’t meet intake criteria.

I was responsible for Rails back-end work, with Mitchell handling the front-end, and Daniel facilitating as PM.

title: GroupUs
subtitle: Spring 2019
summary: GroupUs is a modular group registration web application developed using the MERN tech stack as part of an Independent Study at Brandeis University.
description:
GroupUs is a modular group registration web application developed with the MERN tech stack. Initially developed as a commission for an Interact District Conference, myself and the initial co-developer Mitchell Dodell teamed up with R Matthews to iterate upon it in an Independent Study under Prof. Hickey at Brandeis.

I was responsible for Mongo, Express, and Node back-end work, with Mitchell handling React/Redux on the front-end, and R facilitating as PM.

title: Planneasy
subtitle: Summer 2018
summary: A rewrite of my high school senior project, Planneasy is a material design planner for education & daily use via a Chrome extension & Android app, syncing between both!
description:
A material design, to-do list/planner for education & daily use. This is a rewrite of an old project which I completed for senior options in high school.

This new version has two releases: an Android app and a Chrome extension, allowing for users to sync and maintain notes between devices. The focus of the application has also changed from longer form multimedia embeds to shorter notes. It utilizes Firebase for data storage and persistence.

modal_links.text: Install on the Chrome Web Store (Chrome Extension)

title: Apptopia
subtitle: Summer 2018
summary: My 2018 summer internship was in Boston at Apptopia, where I developed integrations to Apptopia's data with Python, Flask, Pandas, JS, and internal & third party APIs.
description:
Apptopia for Chrome is one of three public interfaces/integrations of Apptopia's data that I created this summer as part of my internship. Over the course of the internship, I developed Apptopia for Chrome, Slack, and Sheets, integrations allowing Apptopia customers to access app and publisher data within the comfort of their browser/workspace/data sources. It displays apps or publishers via the website URL you visit in the case of Chrome, or information provided in the case of Sheets and Slack.

Data points accessible in the integration include MAUs, DAUs, downloads, total app revenue, and store rank. Data points are ranged or precise estimates depending upon the company's Apptopia subscription. The integration was made using JS for the extension (Chrome and Sheets), and Python, Flask, MongoDB and Pandas for the endpoints.

I also was responsible for the creation of assets and graphics to market the integrations, and day-to-day data requests from clients using Apptopia's API.
